subject: Learning
title: The Pandemic Classroom Experiment
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Pandemic Classroom Experiment.

hook.text: In March 2020, 1.6 billion students were sent home overnight. The largest education experiment in history began.

buildup.text: Schools scrambled to move online. Teachers with no tech training ran Zoom classes from their kitchens.

discovery.text: Students with devices and quiet spaces adapted. Those without fell months or years behind.

twist.text: The digital divide wasn't newâ€”the pandemic just made it visible and urgent.

climax.text: Learning loss was steepest for the most disadvantaged students, widening existing inequality.

punchline.text: The pandemic didn't break education. It exposed what was already broken.

quiz.question: What did the pandemic reveal about education systems?
options: Existing inequalities were exposed and widened by the digital divide
All students adapted equally well to online learning
Online education is always better than in-person
